element_texts.text:
San Francisco
Aug 30 1883
When I went to bed last night we had already passed the Light house on which depended our entrance into the Golden Gate, but the fog was so thick & we poked along
so slowly that all went to bed with full assurance that we would not get into dock until late this AM. I was therefore rather surprised at I am this morning on being awakened by the anchor going down to find on looking out that

Broke up that arrangement at once - & got into one suite  - with a room over for Judge Grey 
Breakfasted at 7 - then all seperated - went to Bank with Genl who gave me $200 - Schofield called & brought our letters one from Worthington with a check for $988.20  June payment on my Book - 30,149 copies sold all together which is very comforting - Nothing but good news all around - Took a turn about City with Mendenhall - Visited all the Markets - subsequently I went to see the old [?Place?]

the gas lights of the city-
were blazing full afore 
us. It was a pretty 
sight. No houses seen or 
shipping - only long row 
of gaslights.
Turned in again very 
content - About 5 am.   
The Genl rousted us up.
very much against our will -
& we went ashore - were met
by a Qr Ms Ajt who took
charge of checks & furnished
[?cannon?] & baggage  wagon -
Reached Palace Hotel by
6 - to find that we had been 
given almost a floor - Each
of us having a suite
of four rooms.

San Francisco
Aug 30, 83-
Up & Breakfast 8 am.
Took a walk- then went 
after Paymaster- Drew
pay for July & August
& transpn up to this point
amtg to $181- + some cents-
about noon commenced on
my letters, & continued 
with- very little intermission
until 11pm - though 
I got tired about 5 pm
& took a turn around 
the city- It is a very 
compact city- & don't
take much time to go over.

of Yerba Buena- & 
by accident fell into 
China- where I spent
at least an hour examining
a thousand curious things-
Boy with baby strapped on
his back. Vegetables
Nice looking Chinese Ladies
Queer shoes & costumes-
Dinner at 5- at 8 PM
went to look for [?Mrs?] Bibby
Found her & was really
touched by the demonstration
of affection of herself &
Maurie - They quite
"set me up"- I have not

had so much kissing in 

many a day- To bed
at 11 pm--

23 miles by rail, very curious country, dry parched - an arid desert but growing evidence of the most splendid crops - [?] in house - Belmont wonderful place - beautiful room for 50 guests.  True hospitality - every one over as he pleases  Excellent dinner - fine wines & liquor and [?li..?] Noble live oaks - Ivy killing them - beautiful country places - No water - The desert blossoms as the rose - [?Boon?] of money - to bed 1 am of 2d

San Francisco Sepr 1. 1883
Went out about 11 am after posting my letters- Gen Bibby came down to see me & spent an hour - Met Burt & did the town in his comfy [?B....ght?] a new [?..atch?]  met Royal T. Frank & lots of officers - At 4 pm Judge Grey, Tidball & myself started on train for Menlo Park  Guests of ExSen Sharon
[Upside down at bottom of page and crossed out]
Mr Justice Grey
Shared box cigars 1.25
29 Dinner 75

San Francisco  Sep 3d, 1883
Tidball & I took breakfast out this am at a common restaurant where they dont charge a dozen prices - Gnl Arrived about 9.30 then the others began to drop in - At 10 15 took carriage then boat - Visited Alcatraz first - Frank? in [?] Everything lovely  Somber place - all up & down - a lovely walk - prison - Then we steamed for Angel Island & found a lovely little port in a cañon - spent an hour very pleasantly  Burt in command
covered?

San Francisco Sep 2 1883
Big head & late breakfast  About 11 we all started for a ride to Menlo Park. -Floods palace - Regal state - wonders of cash  Houses grounds, statuary stables horses - Kindly entertained by the Flood family Other elegant places - Retd 3 pm gorged with splendor - Fine dinner missed train - Tried again - made it & got to Hotel 8 pm - all right but dazed with splendor

San Francisco    Sepr 4th
Went out with Gen Bibby to see the houses of the big boys --

 Loafed around city 
 Couldn't find anybody 
 Stayed away until Genl & Tidball went off to the GAR reunion then went to bed
 San Francisco    Sepr 5th -

Started at 11 am for Alameda to visit Pollock & family - Arrived about 1 pm - nice family - after lunch took a long ride. Beautiful

Luncheon & drinks all around - Then steamed for Black Point Schofield Hdqrs for more drinks & another lunch - Took carriage for the Presidio where we reviewed five long Cos Arty & had a good show - Anderson in Court - Mendenhall & Randel Majors - After about 2 hours we again took Carriage & returned to Black Point to dine with Schofield - nice dinner - at 9 pm we returned to city & to bed rather the worse for wear 
[Upside down at bottom of page and crossed out]
June 29
Chief Justice Waite
Dinner   75

San Francisco
Sepr 6 - 1883
Had one of my old time Whiskey Belly aches today & was utterly miserable until about 3 pm. Laid in bed most of morning   In evening went to dinner with Genl Keyes. Met Governor Stoneman -- twenty of the biggest boys & had a pleasant party

Came back & went to bed about 12 pm

places in the foot Hills
Got back home about 10 30 pm & went to bed 

 Genl & Tidball back about 12, Rousted me up & blew me up for not going to the M.O.S.L. & S reception. Glad to get out of it.
 Must ?recolect? Mrs Thompson & her daughter Mrs King - the latter an exceptionally pleasant woman - sister of Mrs Pollock - The little Pollock very sweet - friendly --
  A pleasant day --

Tidball & Judge Grey absent -- After dinner packed all my things - then at 8.30 pm started with Mendenhall to see Chinatown -- Hired a policeman. Saw all sorts of sights & went to Theater.

 Got through all about midnight & returned home to write up four days of this Diary & then to bed.

San Francisco  Sepr 7, 83
Went with Mendenhall to Presidio - then to Fort Point - Met Dr Eakin & took some drinks with him 
Then to Cliff House   Nice lunch - Seals - Park - Cemetery - At 5.30 pm went to bid goodby to Gen Bibby  Home at 4 pm -went to [?pash....?]  Genl & I dined together at 5 -
[Upside down at bottom of page, crossed out]
Col. Tidball
Share box cigs  1.25
dinner    75

Sierra Madre Villa
Sepr 9 1883 --
Woke up just in time to be too late to see the desert, as the train was just entering the Canon - Fine Engineering.
Arrived Los Angeles before 8 am & at San Gabriel at 840  Left our car on sd track to wait for us - & took carriage for Sierra Madre Villa which we reached by 10 am Lovely place - Orange groves, figs, pomegranates English walnuts limes & lemons, everything of Tropical growth.

On Train. Sepr 8

 Left S.F. at 9 to take 9.30 train for Los Angeles
 Have a beautiful car - that of the president of the road & travel in style.
 The servants are excellent & we are served sumptuously.
 Very hot & dusty in the San Joaquin Valley -- Miles of wheat. Big ferry boat
 Genl & Judge went to bed early. I sat till 11 pm talking with a Mr Bridger a civil engineer & ex-officer of Vols.

Took an excellent lunch at 12 m & then went to bed tired out with heat & activity --

 Good dinner at 6 pm & to bed by 10 --

Dolce far niente    [Italian:pleasant idleness]

[Bottom of page upside down and crossed out]
Genl Sherman - shared box cigars 1.25

on this coast. Has 800 acres in grapes 300 in fruits - 7 or 800 in grain -- Saw all the process of wine making Shall stick to whiskey henceforth -- Then to Shorb, Wilson & Stoneman wonderful vineyards --
More wonderful orchards apples, peaches, pears, oranges lemons limes nectarines pomegranates olives figs Black & English walnuts almonds. Everything in the temperate & tropic zones --

Returned 3 pm tired out - nap - Dinner & to bed again 10.30 pm

Sierra Madre Villa
Sepr 10th 1883 -
After breakfast we took carriage & started for a survey of the show places of this Valley -

 First to Baldwins the man called Lucky Baldwin for his uniform luck in stock operations --
 A magnificent place & small insignificant house - no room for guests - place worth half a million house not more than three thousand.
 Then to Rose the great manufacturer of wine

bottles of fine old whiskey & we were then driven to our car. Soon after 5 pm we were hitched on to the regular pass'r train - taken to Mohave station when we are side tracked to wait for the Eastern train tomorro.

 Los Angeles very beautiful growing rapidly. Oranges Lemons limes grapes in endless variety. Visited a Banana plantation in leaving. Beautiful ornamental garden - finest I have seen - belongs to a man named Dillenbach

Mohave Station
on Special Car
Sepr 11th 1883
Took an early breakfast then carriage to Depot.
Hitched our car on to the 9.05 train & arrived at Los Angeles 10 am where we were met by Genl Boughton & wife & a Mr Lynch editor of a paper in carriages into which we were taken & driven about the city until 1 pm then taken to the Pico House & entertained with wondrous lunch.

 Mr Lynch presented us with half a dozen

Fort Wingate  Sepr 13 - 83
Found ourselves this am  well up on the San Francisco Mountains - Cool & pretty - pine woods - open glades good grass - Saw Mills - good engineering - Summit crossing - abominable place & country  [?Se th..overed..?]  on creek - Big trees in stone - Arrived Wingate Station 5 pm.  Lieut Bradley & a lot of his officers took ambulance for post 3 miles - Dined with Bradley who had a reception at night Went home with the

On Train   Sept 12, 1883
Terrible wind storm during night tho the natives say it was unusually mild   A special engine took us in tow about 7 am - we went into the desert - Arrived at The Needles about 5 pm & at once transferred our baggage into a special car of the A & P R.R.  After waiting about an hour we went on - Crossed Colorado on a tiny [?] bridge.  Kept awake until too dark to see then went to bed - Yucca Sand Mohave River - Silver Valley

Santa Fe. NM  Sepr 15, 83
Was kept awake by people & did not get over an hours sleep all night.  Just getting a comfortable send off that way when porter roused me - 4 am - got up of course but the train due at 5 did'nt arrive until 7 am  Heavy frost last night & very hail storm here yesterday doing great damage - Breakfast at Wallace arrive Santa Fe 12.30 pm.  Mackenzie & staff  nap at palace Hotel  Dined with Mackenzie

[?Rep Gorn St Manifort?] & spent the night - Met a lot of pleasant people  [?Fine?] [?manual?] of areas - Post fair to midling - poor band -
Albuquerque NM Sepr 14th 1883
Left post 10 am & arrived in Albuquerque about 4.30 - Met by a deputation with carriages who took us over all the new & old towns - Then at 7 30 pm a dinner at the [?Arrunjo?] House - then adjourned to Aztec Club for speeches & wine - Then at 12 pm to car & bed

the altitude - In afternoon strolled again - at 7 pm Tidball & I went the rounds - visiting all the Ladies - Visited the fair grounds in morning - Had a very pleasant evening - part of it spent at a gambling house where however there was no play - only [?] in conversation - met a pleasant lot of people today & tonight & had a very good time - [?Dickey?] of 22 our pilot - To bed at 11 pm

- Did not get away until about 10 pm - Mail - Letters from Joe & Laura & other parties - Tidball [?in...ted?] me - I did not get to bed until 12 pm
Santa Fe Sepr 16, 1883
Breakfast at 8 am  Stroll after for an hour  wrote letters & took nap   At 1.30 was roused by a Servt who said that the Genl wanted me at dinner - went down & dined - then to my room & to bed again  Greatly opposed by

On Car   Sepr 18. 83
About 1 am we arrived at Durango & switched off on side track - All up by 6 am   The town much better than I expected - 2500 inhabitants & good stores of specialities - Expected ambulances to meet us. but found none - By accident a post ambulance came in with paymaster we gobbled it - arrived at Ft Lewis 11 am - Hall in Com?  Had recd no telegram & did'nt know we were coming  Arm of a Corpl blown off in firing salute -

On Cars   Sepr 17, 1883
Up at 5 am at 6 took ambulances & had a very delightful ride of 28 miles to Espanola arriving at 11 am.  Found train waiting for us - Presidents car & Kitchen car.  Pulled out as soon as we got our baggage on board.  Rio Grande valley all cultivated   Fine canon & good engineering.  Arrived Antonito 3 pm  Took main line west - Toltec canon - fine scenery - To bed 10 pm after a day of very varied pleasures - good food

On car Sepr19 -
Slept peacefully on side track until 6 am, then got up, as the train continued moving toward Silverton. Splendid ride. Arrived Silverton 10am. Walked & rode around until after 12 - then took car - & returning over our route had a good view of the route unclear to & on the San Juan river Bright overtook us before we arrived at Toltec Gorge. So did not see it again. went to bed 10 pm.

Dont fancy post badly located - badly built -- The 22d a fancy horse-riding Regt. And a very pleasant set of Offrs - Spent a dull day - while the Genl & Tidball went around. Elevation  8000 ft - & oppressive. 
Dined with Hale & staff -- at 8.45 p.m. took ambulance for Durango.
Bright moonlight night A "lackles" scratched out lovely ride but a little risky as the driver was full -
13 miles in 1 hour & 35 m
To bed on car

is improved out of my knowledge. Some very handsome buildings. Bids fair to be a fine city. Met Bancroft Supt. RR - who I used to know when at Fort Dodge.
Strolled about city after dinner. Pretty rough place. Met several people whom I have known before.
Returned to car at 9 pm & went to bed soon after. Very tired

Pueblo, Sep 20.
Waked up by hearing some one say no we're at [?Vita?] - which is on east side of the mountains. Got up soon after - about 9 am we arrived at Pueblo. [Crossed out: Got lunch & then] Took carriages to visit the steel works. Very interesting. Ret'd & got lunch. Then at 3 pm carriages again to visit the silver smelters. Not greatly impressed. Rode about city. It

Gunnison a growing town. Fair hotel. Black Canon canyon of Gunnison river. Very fine - passed old fishing ground of mine on Cimarron where I fell in creek 3 years ago - Passed in cars over my old road. Couldn't see post of ? & could recognize scarcely anything. Ran down river to mouth -  all settled up. Towns & farms 
Went to bed just after the train passed the Grand  River ? Oration? for Citizens

On cars, Sepr 21.
At 6 am an engine took us in hand & away we went. Got up early to see Canon of Arkansas. Splendid. About noon we left Arkansas & entered the Marshall pass. Not so fine as to scenery, but engineering magnificent, pass 10,500 feet above sea level - highest words scratched out RR pass in the U.S. From top can see train on west side apparently under our feet - got up & down all safe

Salt Lake City
Sepr 23d, 83
I spent yesterday after noon doing the city, the churches etc. & it was fortunate for I had little time today.
Devoted morning to writing letters. Genl & party came down to Hotel to lunch with Erb. All lunched together then went to the Tabernacle. I stood the nonsensical gabble for an hour & left. Went down to Lake - pleasant ride. beautiful colors of water at sunset. Tame

Salt Lake City
Sepr 22d, 83
Beautiful landscape & colors. Arrived at Salt Lake City about 1 pm. General & Judge  went to the Fort with Mr Cook?. Tidball & I to the Walker House - Erb proprietor -. Very good house. After dinner Erb drove me up to the Fort to a Ball. Very pleasant met all the people. Danced once. Talked &  drank & had a good time. To bed 2 am

On Cars
Sepr 25th 83
When I woke up the train was stationary at Gunnison. Soon moved. At Salida took road for Leadville where we arrived 3 pm. Were met by the G.A.R. a big turn out. Took carriages for the mines. Did not go down.
Nice supper at Continental? Hotel. [crossed out: Genl He]
Genl held informal reception after. I took a turn around town. Regular mining town - rough.
Left at 10pm Very well pleased.
Altitude 10,300 ft

gulls. Back to City 7pm. Loafed much. Wrote letters packed then went to bed 10 pm.
On Cars 
Sepr 24th 83
Erb would not let Tidball or I pay any bill at Hotel. Went to cars at 8:30 & were soon found by Genl.
Got off at 9:30 am. Quiet day. Reached Crossing of Green River at dark & went to bed 9 pm

Denver Col    Sepr 27 -
Met Hatch early am & we did the town together City Hall. Fire Dept etc. GAR took possession of Genl & Tidball & kept them going all day. At night we all went to Theater to see Langrishe in the serious family - only tolerable. Went to bed 11 ½ pm tired out & glad the day was over - Denver a large & prosperous City growing rapidly
________________________________________________________
Note re Langrishe - Comedian of the Frontier
https://www.historycolorado.org/sites/default/files/media/document/2018/ColoradoMagazine_v46n4_Fall1969.pdf
Page 29

Denver
Sepr 26
Woke up with cars stationary at Cañon City. 2 bridges burned last night ahead of us. About 11am got off. Crossed bridges safely. Arrived Pueblo 1:30 pm & Denver 5 30 pm
Met by the G.A.R. & a rousing crowd. Went to Windsor Hotel. Very good. Genl and Tidball went to GAR at night. I cut it ?met? Hatch of Fort Lyon memory. Went to bed 11 pm tired.
